intro: Daucus gummifer subsp. hispidus, commonly known as the hairy cow parsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
